name: Lilia
tagline: A Scheme-like programming language running in the browser.
body:
### What is Lilia?
Lilia is a [Scheme](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scheme_%28programming_language%29)-like programming language with an interpreter created to be easily accessible. You can access the interpreter from everywhere using a modern web browser.

### What is the difference with the other online Scheme interpreters?
Maybe you have already used the online interpreters of [repl.it](http://repl.it/languages/Scheme) or even [قلب](http://qlb-repl.herokuapp.com/) (pronounced 'alb). They are quite great to check whether some simple code works. What Lilia tries to do (or plans to do) is to provide the programmer with more user-friendly messages and helpful tools.

### Support or Contact
If you found a problem or have a suggestion for Lilia, please leave a comment at [https://github.com/ipelovski/lilia/issues](https://github.com/ipelovski/lilia/issues).
